amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to temporarily increase H-1B visas from 65,000 to 95,000 in 1998, to 105,000 in 1999, to 115,000 in 2000, and then return to 65,000 in 2001.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 2 printed in the Congressional Record to increase H-1B program visas from 65,000 to 95,000 in 1998, 105,000 in 1999, 115,000 in 2000, and return to 65,000 in 2001 and subsequent years. The increases are offset by a decrease in H-2B visas allowed each year.

action.text: Amendment (A001) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Watt (NC).
On agreeing to the Watt (NC) amendment (A001) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 177 - 242 (Roll No. 459).
